title: Lecture by Claudia Calirman: Brazilian Art in the 1960s and 1970s—A Kaleidoscopic Experience
hero_caption: <p>Antonio Dias.&nbsp;<em>Note on the Unforeseen Death</em>,&nbsp;1965. Artist’s collection. Photo by Vicente de Mello.</p>
description:
In the second lecture of the Oiticica series, Claudia Calirman, John Jay College of Criminal Justice, City University of New York, examines Brazilian art between 1968 and 1975, the most repressive years of the military dictatorship that ruled Brazil for two decades.

Upcoming lecture in the Oiticica series:

James Rondeau Thursday, May 4 at 6:00

Presented with Society for Contemporary Art

*This is an after-hours program and does not require a separate museum admission ticket. The Michigan Avenue doors open at 5:45.
